title: Coolant Pressure Cap and Coolant System Testing

body.body: Coolant Pressure Cap and Coolant System Testing
Do not remove the expansion tank or coolant pressure cap when the engine is hot.
When the engine is hot, the coolant inside the cooling system will be hot and may also be under pressure.
Contact with this hot, pressurised coolant may cause minor or moderate injury.
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Allow the engine temperature to cool for a minimum of 30 minutes.
Check the condition of the upper and lower seals of the coolant pressure cap.
If there are signs of damage or deterioration, replace the cap.
Pressure test the cap and cooling system to the blow off pressure of 1.1 bar as described below using
. If the cap opens at a lower pressure or fails to open at 1.1 bar, replace the cap.
It is recommended to carry out coolant pressure cap and cooling system pressure tests consecutively.

Select the bayonet type adaptor and securely attach it to the radiator.
Carefully connect the hand pump to the bayonet connector. Make sure that there is an an air tight seal.
Use the hand pump to pressurise the cooling system to the operating pressure. Do not exceed the maximum cap pressure.
Hold the pressure for a minimum of 10 minutes, whilst visually inspecting the external components of the coolant system for leaks.
